main event: Four unidentified objects were sighted in the sky over Erie, Pennsylvania on August 26, 1965.
interesting points: The objects were observed for a total duration of 3 seconds.
The objects were described as circular or oval shaped, metallic in appearance, and emitting a pulsating glow or light.
The objects changed direction abruptly without slowing down and then accelerated at a high rate, disappearing from view.
The observer provided a sketch depicting the compass-like motion of the objects.
The observer estimated the size of the objects to be about the size of a dime at arm's length.
